description.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide formal education opportunities for refugee children (3-17 years old) .

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide formal education opportunities for refugee children (3-17 years old) .

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the Ministry of National Education and other national partners in strengthening the education system to provide learning opportunities to all children (including those in preschool), with a particular focus on refugee children. With UNICEF's support, the number of Syrian refugee children transitioning from Temporary Education Centers to Turkish Public Schools has increased from 86% in the 2018/2019 academic year to 96% in the 2019/2020 school year, with a total number of 684,728 registered refugee children in formal education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - School-aged children and adolescents in affected areas back in school (including early childhood education programmes) after interruption or newly enrolled since the emergency
# of Syrian teachers operating under the Management strategy for education personnel providing services to children under temporary protection

baseline.value: 8,716 Syrian teachers operating as volunteer teachers and receiving a financial incentive under the current management strategy
